item.description:

[quote=“ollie123, post:27, topic:439154”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=541853.msg3971791#msg3971791 date=1334234448]

People that are idiotic enough to get a virus in the first place deserve it.
[/quote]While this is true it sometimes can be unavoided as well. Such as cache updates. If jagex wanted to infect millions of people through their cache updating we would be screwed without knowing it as they are a trusted company.

True, but that is extremely unlikely and the company’s reputation would be irrevocably destroyed.[/quote]I’ve heard of companies doing stuff like this

item.title: Big macs
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:20, topic:439154”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=541853.msg3970933#msg3970933 date=1334144173]

To those who are trying to disparage the Macintosh computer:

Hah! Don’t kid yourselves Mac-haters. Regarding the OS, Macs remain better protected and reliable. No OS is absolutely perfect, and you certainly experience that first-hand on your Windows machines.
[/quote]Macs are just as bad as Windows. The reason why Macs and LInux/Unix/Aix systems are so much rarer to get viruses on are becuase not as many people use them.

If Linux was used as much as Windows for that matter then there would be more known viruses.

I agree on the first part, no hacker wants to hack a small group of computer users.

I do believe Linux’s kernel is setup it can’t get any viruses.[/quote]All linux systems are infectable but depending on the way you have your network set up it would be quite hard.

Read full topic

item.title: Big macs
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:19, topic:439154”][quote author=TheCyberMan link=topic=541853.msg3970894#msg3970894 date=1334131276]
To those who are trying to disparage the Macintosh computer:

Hah! Don’t kid yourselves Mac-haters. Regarding the OS, Macs remain better protected and reliable. No OS is absolutely perfect, and you certainly experience that first-hand on your Windows machines.
[/quote]Macs are just as bad as Windows. The reason why Macs and LInux/Unix/Aix systems are so much rarer to get viruses on are becuase not as many people use them.

If Linux was used as much as Windows for that matter then there would be more known viruses.[/quote]

I agree on the first part, no hacker wants to hack a small group of computer users.

I do believe Linux’s kernel is setup it can’t get any viruses.

Read full topic
